overview: Miss Candace Hilligoss' Flickering Halo is a film about the interval simultaneously separating and uniting, the silence between words, the black between pictures. It is a film against the dialectical opposites in cinema, assembled according to the Heisenberg's uncertainty principle and the use of the phenomenon of retinal persistence as an expressive tool.
title: Miss Candace Hilligoss’ Flickering Halo
